quest.name: Acht-la Ormh Inn
journal: Seto would wish you well on your way.

With the Eulmoran Army fast approaching, there isn't a moment to waste. Having furnished you with the crystal shoes, Seto wishes you well on your mission, and you depart at once for Lyhe Ghiah, where the Lightwarden awaits...

At the arrival of the bearer of all four relics, the seal protecting the castle is broken. All that remains is to venture inside and confront the Light-corrupted king of the faeries, Titania.

※The Dancing Plague can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
At the end of a frenzied struggle, you emerge victorious over the Lightwarden, thereby restoring night to Il Mheg.

Joining you inside Lyhe Ghiah, Feo Ul declares that, by the laws of Il Mheg, you should rightly take your defeated foe's place as king. Before you can ponder a life spent frolicking with the faeries, however, your beautiful branch shoulders this burden in your stead. Thus empowered, the pixie leads an army to Lydha Lran and repels the invading Eulmoran forces. Though your struggles are far from over, the day─or rather, the night─is yours.

Beneath a benevolent blanket of stars, Urianger congratulates you on your victory. With the Lightwarden's defeat, you are one step closer to accomplishing your goal, and under their new ruler, it is not impossible that the faeries may one day prove useful allies...assuming, of course, they feel like it.
objectives: Confront Titania in the Dancing Plague.

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: Forgive me, it seems my indecision has cost you precious time.

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: But I am convinced now. Convinced that you will triumph.

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: To the south you will find the bridge to Lyhe Ghiah. As the bearer of the four relics, the gate to the castle will open to you.

dialogue.name: SETO
dialogue.text: I could not say these words to Ardbert, but I say them now to you: go safely.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: The gate has recognized that you bear all four relics. The seal is broken.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: All that remains is to enter the castle and confront Titania─a being bereft of reason and mercy.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: It is sure to be a ferocious battle. But if anyone can bring an end to our king's torment, it is you.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: Yet know this, my adorable sapling: though we fae folk may appear to live unfettered lives, there are still laws that bind us.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: To take back as much as is taken. To create as much as is destroyed. To give as much as is received.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: In all things, balance must be preserved...and the same will be asked of you.

dialogue.name: FEOUL
dialogue.text: But worry not. Come what may, your beautiful branch will ever be at your side.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It was pure luck that we managed to hold the Eulmorans at bay long enough for you to succeed─but we have earned some good fortune. And while it is plain we've not seen the last of General Ran'jit, I for one am glad to delay our reckoning with him awhile longer.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It seems I was wrong about your friend. Had Feo Ul not stepped in, you'd be frolicking with the faeries by now.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well done, my friend. You put me to shame, laying low a Lightwarden while I struggle to land a blow on a man old enough to be my great-grandsire.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm going to train harder. Having seen what you've achieved, it's the least I can do.

dialogue.name: SULUIN
dialogue.text: Madbloom or no, we have a new Titania! The king is returned! All hail the king!

dialogue.name: YSIALA
dialogue.text: If you ever see that wrinkly old man again, pay him back for me ten─nay, a thousandfold!

dialogue.name: OULSIGUN
dialogue.text: Did you see the looks on their faces as they ran? Ohhh, it was delicious!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ne'er for a moment did I doubt that thou wouldst triumph over thy foe─yet the majesty of thine achievement delighteth me nonetheless!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Night hath returned to Il Mheg, and we stand one step closer to delivering the First from its doom, and averting the Eighth Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis but a pity thou wert not present to see the fae folk put the Eulmorans to flight. 'Twas a sight to raise the spirits, I do assure thee!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ah, but what valuable allies they might prove...were the mood only to take them.
